nodes.bodyText: Then number of elements found CSS selector `$cssSelector` in HTML `$html` is $comparisonRule `$quantity`
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -56,6 +48,36 @@ return Optional.empty(); } + /** + * Checks if HTML contains elements according to rule by CSS selector + * @param html HTML to check + * @param comparisonRule The rule to compare values + *
(Possible values: + *
less than (<), + *
less than or equal to (<=), + *
greater than(>) + *
greater than or equal to(>=), + *
equal to(=)) + * @param number Number of elements + * @param cssSelector CSS selector + * @see CSS Selector Reference + * @see Jsoup Selector API + * @return true if elements quantity corresponds to rule, false otherwise + */ + @Then("HTML `$html` contains $comparisonRule $number elements by CSS selector `$cssSelector`")

nodes.bodyText: what about reusing here a logic from a new step?
